handNote.p: Tamil script. Unblackened. 3 to 4 lines per column. One hand only.

binding.p: Woodcovers (pinewood) apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: 1842–1843. See U1b, f6r:cupakiṟa = cupakirutu year of 60-year the Jovian cycle.

acquisition.p: The f20v(library foliation), that is U3, f11, the last of the blank folios, is inscribed:"R.B. [N]° 4530 bis. 1847." The "Registre B" of the BnF records under this entry atthe date of August 15th, 1847, the acquisition of 4 items from "Schwaighauser. Elèvede l'école des chartes". Our manuscript, the first item in the list, is describedas: "Un ms tamoul sur palmes, de 20 feuillets ??? (la) couverture, attaché avec uncordon rouge ???".

body.p: The bundle contains two works attributed to Auvaiyār: the Ātticūṭi (complete) and theKoṉṟaivēntāṉ (incomplete; first nine aphorisms only). These works are often used forlearning the Tamil alphabet as the aphorisms are ordered alphabetically andrepresent all the letters of the Tamil alphabet. The present manuscript, fromPondicherry (see U1b, f[6]r, c2, 3), might be a school exercise, as it containsmistakes apparently due to inexperience (e.g. confusion between the letters ṉ and ḷ, of similar shape).The lay-out of the page is in columns for the mūlam.
The bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains between the two woodcovers:
U1b: 6 folios, no foliation except f2 with Tamil foliation 2 = Ātticūṭi, mūlam.
U3: 11 folios, no foliation = blank leaves.
Paratexts: marginal benedictions; invocations; completionstatement; scribal colophon.

U1a, folio 1, recto,unfoliated = Ātticūṭi, invocation: marginalbenedictions; stanza.
(f[1]r, lm1) ha Om
(f[1]r, lm2) naṉṟāka
(f[1]r, lm3) kuru vāḻka
(f[1]r, c1, 1) kuruvē tuṇai
(f[1]r, c2, 1) Ātticūṭi-y amainta tēvarai-y ētti-y ētti toḻuvōm nāmē{pcs}

U1b, folio 1, recto,unfoliated = Ātticūṭi, incipit, mūlam: marginal benediction; first 3 aphorisms.
(f[1]r, lm, 1–2) naṉṟāka
(f[1]r, c1, 1) Aṟañ ceyal virumpu
(f[1]r, c1, 2) āṟuvatu ciṉam
(f[1]r, c1, 3) iyalvatu karavēṉ [i.e. karavēl]
(...)

U1b, folio 5, verso,unfoliated, folio 6, recto,unfoliated = Ātticūṭi, excipit, mūlam: last 3 aphorisms; completion statement; scribalcolophon.
(...)
(f[5]v, c3, 1) vaikaṟait tuyil oḻi [i.e. eḻu]
(f[5]v, c3, 1) v-oṉṉārai-c cēṟēṉ [i.e. tēṟēl]
(f[5]v, c3, 1) v-ōtuvatu vētam [instead of ōram collēl]
(f[6]r, c1, 1) v-auvaiyār
(f[6]r, c1, 2) Aruḷa ceyta
(f[6]r, c1, 3) nīticcol muṟṟum
(f[6]r, c2, 1) cupakiṟa {varuṣam} taiyi {mācam} {mutal}
(f[6]r, c2, 2) y-eḻutiṉatu Ātticuvaṭi [i.e. Ātticuṭi]
(f[6]r, c2, 3) putuvaiyil

U2a, folio 1, recto,unfoliated = Koṉṟaivēntāṉ, invocation:stanza.
(f[1]r1) koṉṟai-y vēntaṉ celvaṉ aṭiyiṉai-y eṉṟum ētti toḻuvōm yāmē {pcs}

U2b, folio 1, recto,unfoliated, folio 1, verso,unfoliated = Koṉṟaivēntāṉ, mūlam, incipit andexcipit: first 9 aphorisms.
(f[1]r, c1, 1) aṉṉaiyum pitāvum
(f[1]r, c1, 2) muṉṉaṟi teyvam
(f[1]r, c1, 3) Ālaiyam toḻuvatu
(f[1]r, c2, 1) cālava [blank space] [i.e. cālavum] naṉṟu
(...)
(f[1]v, c2, 3) y-ēvā makkaḷ
(f[1]v, c3, 1) mūvā maruntu
(f[1]v, c3, 2) Ayyam pu ? kil
(f[1]v, c3, 3) ceyviṉai cey
[The manuscript stops short here]
Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin,U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, andē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is notclearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kālor length of o and e)readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated byslash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X".Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets.Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...).Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha lettersin bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towardsright; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number betweensquare brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121"not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphensystematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word orwithin a cīr. Sandhi splitto the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as anapostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible.aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
